summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 1, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in locked-down status, with signatures for each time slot, and were reviewed by a lieutenant and captain. The document is significant as it represents the type of routine monitoring log from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Daily Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Routine 30-minute checks conducted on inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York, as documented on multiple check sheets.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 1, 2019.
It details a protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
Each sheet includes time frames for checks (e.g., 12:00-12:30 AM) with spaces for staff signatures, though no individual staff names are legibly recorded.
The sheets were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, but their names are not provided.
This type of document is relevant to understanding the monitoring procedures in place at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated.
